I used to be more discerning with my alcohol consumption. My compatriots in Gensokyo drink without discrimination and and I’m afraid they’ve rubbed off on me.
I sense some confusion in your heart, ~player~, about why I am called “Crown Prince.” By which I mean, you’re worried I’ve got a penis.
You may be wondering where my ceremonial rod goes when I’m not using it. That’s easy. It’s magic.
I’m ambidextrous, by the way. If you were wondering why my ceremonial baton shifts from hand to hand.
The proper name for my ritual baton is a shaku. I find many outsiders aren’t familiar with it.
My sword is a Chinese jian known as the Shichi-Sei Ken, or Seven-Star Sword.
Most of the time people try to hold conversations with me, they just spout boring nonsense like “You’re mistaken I’m not a hermit” and “This isn’t necessary stop fighting me”.
My wife passed away a while ago. Anyway you met her earlier. Other than the ghost legs she’s pretty much the same as ever.
Were I to unsheathe my sword, all would be blinded by its magnificence. Including myself, frustratingly.
Are you wondering how I got here? I have no need for Occult Balls or Gaps. Every crack contains infinite space, which I can inhabit.
Not every story you've heard about me is true. For instance, I wasn't born in a stable.
~player~, should you hold an interest in the Taoist Arts, my dojo is accessible from any crack.
”Danmaku?” It is the term of the colored bullets we citizens of Gensokyo shoot each other with, either for fun or to annihilate our opponents.
Gensokyo is the land of illusion. All that passes into myth passes into Gensokyo.
I don’t think at this stage I’ll be having any more children, though. Too bad as well. I’d love to impregnate Tojiko!
Because she studied the Taoist arts, after death Tojiko ended up as a ghost with a corporeal body. Eheheh…
It was because of Futo that Tojiko failed to properly resurrect in a new body. Did I mention Futo is Tojiko’s mother? I know someone who’s not getting a card this year~!
Deliver to me ~cards~ cards.
~cards~ would be a viable strategy!
~cards~ cards, at once!
I desire ~cards~ cards.
If you can't hear my desires, I would like ~cards~ cards.
Is this a Buddhist plot?
It's a Moriya Shrine conspiracy!
I wonder if Yoshika would eat these cards for me...
Yukari is fooling around again...
Now witness a miracle as I, Toyosatomimi no Miko, win with this paltry hand!
Are those damn poverty god sisters skulking about?
I shall forgive you dealer, if only for a bit.
These cards are not worthy of me. Still, I shall accept them.
Crown Prince... you don't have a damn thing.
Crown Prince, this hand is garbage.
Crown Prince, are you even trying to preserve your modesty?
I miss my cape.
Are you related to the Youkai of Flowers, Princess Amalia?
Princess Amalia, know you a troublesome youkai called Yuuka?
You know Beatrix, you’re kind of a pain. Though as long as you don’t trap me in an infinite hallway you’re not the worst doctor I’ve ever encountered.
Say Jenetta, are you a Moon Rabbit, or one of the Inaba at the Eternal Princess’s castle?
Madam Joey, are you an Earth Clown or a Hell Clown?
Don’t be silly Lady Meia, Japan is but one part of my planet. I don’t rule over the whole thing… yet.
How rude, Lady Jura. I would never cheat on Tojiko. Especially not with a married woman. Who’s also her mother. It’s complicated.
Meia, you say two women from your realm can make babies? I think the Hourai Pharmacist of Gensokyo can do the same.
By the way, I’d like to put in a complaint that one of Makai’s prisoners escaped. Her name: Byakuren Hijiri. Please come collect her
I must say Lady Nayru, you’re a mean drunk.
So you’re better at cards when drunk, Lady Nayru? I suppose the same could be said of my compatriots in Gensokyo with danmaku.
Be sure to drink plenty of water, Nayru. You don’t want a hangover.
Oh, and it seems you brought a friend, Miss Sakuya. Is this little one a maid in training?
And it appears you let one of the fairy maids tag along, Miss Sakuya. I must say, her peasant attire is simply adorable.
Miss Sakuya, please thank your mistress for her hospitality. By the way, is this girl one of your new hires?
And it appears Lady Furandoore saw fit to invite this bat-winged urchin into her home. Truly her heart has no limits.
Seiga Niang-Niang and Miss Meiling seem to get along well. I saw the two of them speaking in Chinese earlier. They looked over at me and laughed… I wonder what that could mean?
If you do work in the library, it is a most noble job. I even find myself aiding scholars. Just the other day I helped Lady Marisa check out several rare books!
Tojikoooooo! Fetch me some saké! … I’m sure she’s getting it right now.
Most gracious, Lady Sei. I shall have this establishment’s finest sake, please.
Oh, I forgot about your shikigami. Have him pledge his loyalty to me too.
Shimakaze, please. You are of no use to me if you can’t give your life in my defense.
A lovely name, Lady Ochako. I see within you a desire to help others- most commendable.
Quirk, Ochako? Do you mean an ability- like to manipulate feng shui or cause lightning?
Would being able to listen to ten conversations at once suffice as a quirk? Or would my mystical abilities be better suited?
Let me briefly explain my life. When I was born my mother disguised me as a boy, since Sixth Century Japanese women didn’t have the same rights as men. Or any rights, really.
It was surprisingly easy to deceive an entire nation. Men’s clothes and a fake beard did the trick. After all, who would ask a monarch to drop their pants?
Though I had to disguise myself as a prince, a few did find out my true sex during my reign. For instance my aunt, Empress Suiko, on whose behalf I officially ruled.
My consort Tojiko of the Soga clan, known as Tojiko no Iratsume, very much found out about my sex. Fortunately, she preferred to have a woman.
Somehow, the head of the Soga clan, Umako, uncovered the truth- as did his cunning wife, Mononobe no Futo-hime. They were the true rulers of Japan, operating from the shadows.
I was found out by the Wicked, Unreasonable, and Unjust Hermit, Seiga Kaku. Because I told her, she said she’d make me immortal. But not that many people knew the truth. Really.
Ah, you were wondering, ~player~, why I am still called “Crown Prince” though the world has changed in the fourteen hundred years I slept.
In Gensokyo, and in the modern world, there is no reason to hide my womanhood. However, to be called anything but Crown Prince would not sit well with me.
Perhaps it is naught but empty habit, however “Crown Prince” is the appellation I choose to this day.
I see that has cleared up any confusion you had regarding my title. Now, did I ever tell you about the time Seiga stole Christmas?
Futo was a Mononobe who studied Taoism under me, but conspired with her husband Soga no Umako to eradicate her own clan.
The Soga clan and the Mononobe clan were fierce political rivals during my reign. Anyway I killed all the Mononobes and Mokou’s grandpa killed all the Sogas.
I used to be more discerning with my alcohol consumption. My compatriots in Gensokyo drink without discrimination and and I’m afraid they’ve rubbed off on me.
I sense some confusion in your heart, ~player~, about why I am called “Crown Prince.” By which I mean, you’re worried I’ve got a penis.
Since coming to Gensokyo, I worry my comrade Futo has become vulgar and airheaded. Though she was always an odd one.
I’m not short by the way. In case you were thinking that. In the sixth century, this was a pretty average height.
Tojiko is one of the few who see me as a person more than a legend. Perhaps that is why she rarely joins in my escapades.
I introduced Buddhism into Japan as a ruse to pacify the people. Never did I imagine it would be used against me to deny my resurrection!
I don’t think at this stage I’ll be having any more children, though. Too bad as well. I’d love to impregnate Tojiko!
Because she studied the Taoist arts, after death Tojiko ended up as a ghost with a corporeal body. Eheheh…
It was because of Futo that Tojiko failed to properly resurrect in a new body. Did I mention Futo is Tojiko’s mother? I know someone who’s not getting a card this year~!
Now, playtime is over!
I can’t lose again. Enough playing around!
The Kappa are foolish. You just need to throw money at them and they do what you want!
…Powerful and immortal hermits aren’t supposed to taste defeat.
Everyone’s desires speak with the same voice: “take it off!”
Nevermind all that. Tojiko, my garments, if you will.
Don’t worry about stuff like that, Crown Prince. I shall undress you post-haste.
Tojiko, I suppose you can remove my- oh you’ve already started. Thanks.
I am a politician! A general! The hope of humanity! How can a card game be vexing me so?
To think I would meet such a worthy adversary in a card game, of all things…
I suppose I should be thankful no one in the royal court asked this of me, lest my true sex be exposed.
Off with her clothes!
Well? You mustn't keep a regent waiting.
Oh my, and someone here was desiring to see you strip. Other than me, of course.
My, my. It seems ~player~ and I have the same desires regarding ~name~.
Most fights I've been in ended with clothing damage. This doesn't seem much different.
I hope you know I'm not using my Hermit Arts to cheat. You're losing the old fashioned way.
Though I'm sure I could develop a Hermit spell to see through clothes, this method seems... sexier.
Usually it's rude to greet royalty in your skivvies, but I'll let it slide this once.
What clothes do you desire least, Lady ~name~?
Perhaps we should form a consensus about what you must take off next?
Good, this should be pleasing to the eye.
So ~name~, you’re from the land where the sun sets? I’m from the land where the sun rises. It’s the better one.
A clown, eh? I’ve heard of stories of the havoc and terror they sow.
You’ve drinks? Is it a party? I would have brought sake had I known.
The way you’re downing that libation reminds me of… everyone.
You know, Byakuren doesn’t drink. But all the disciples at her temple sneak libations when she isn’t looking. Isn’t that sad?
Aah, booze. The engine of Gensokyo.
I must say, your wardrobe is exquisite. Now take it all off.
Something about this one seems familiar… though I don’t recognize their desires…
I know! You’re ~name~, correct? From the "Electronic Game" that Sumireko girl was talking about?
Are you Japanese, ~name~? Then you must know I, Prince Shoutoku. In fact, I kind of invented Japan.
By the way, I'm glad to see my country continue to thrive a millenia after I left.
On the outside where as much as 1400 years have passed, do the people still speak rightly of my exploits?
It's now or never, so you've got make your decision.
From one royal to another, I respect you resolve, Princess ~name~.
So Princess ~name~, are you the kind of princess who disguises herself as a man and rules their country with wisdom and splendor? Or some other kind?
You handle losing with dignity and grace, Princess.
Princess ~name~, how would you like to unite our two lands? First I need to have a daughter though, for you to marry.
You're quite lovely, Prince ~name~.
Have you ever dreamed of meeting a handsome prince, Lady ~name~?
Hello person I know not. Let's not speak of this again.
By the way, if you recognize me it’s because you mistook me for another gorgeous, wise, and powerful Taoist leader.
You know ~name~… your dark aura reminds me of someone…
So… are you a good witch, or a Buddhist witch?
Witch girl! You had better not steal my garments after the game!
It seems you could not "steal" victory, witch.
Four of a Kind? Wow! I'm as great as I think I am!
It seems I am ever destined for victory.
That could have been close. For someone else.
Excellent. For the sake of those who admire me, I cannot lose.
Come, worship me!
Aella has such an imposing figure. There can be no doubt about it- this girl is an Oni!
Say, are you sure you're not an Oni?
The only difference between you and an Oni is sobriety.
Oh? What’s that gizmo for?
Let’s see your new spellcard, then.
More danmaku? It doesn’t look much different than your other spellcards though.
Let’s see if my teachings have made a difference for you.
Perhaps it would be more effective were I to demonstrate proper danmaku?
Did you expect more friends to drop by, Agent Cammy?
I sense more of your friends are coming. Greetings, I am Toyosatomimi no-
Oh, it appears we're earmuff sisters! Yours are most charming.
It seems your church did not guide you for victory, nekomata.
I don't know if humans can join your church, but clearly, they shouldn't.
I’d try to recruit you nekomata, but I’m more interested in humans.
A nun could never match a saint.
Are you that disease carrying spider youkai I've heard so much about?
A spider youkai? You'd better not infect me!
I apologize for everything that Futo did to you.
Even a clown is no match for my Taoist arts!
Oh no! Stand back everyone! She’s about to unleash her lunatic clown magic!
Clown magic!? Stare not at her, lest your mind be driven to madness
So you two say you come from a world of only women? But I haven’t seen you in Gensokyo before.
Hold on… you live on a flying ship… full of women… named The Nirvana?
Let me look into your heart, Miss Lotte. I shall see if you are an evil witch, or if you’re the kind that isn’t Buddhist.
Miss Lotte, if you desire to learn true sorcery you could always become one of my Taoist acolytes.
Feel free to take my photo, Mahiru. After all, I am gorgeous.
Are you related to that butterfly fairy?
Are you some sort of bug youkai, ~name~?
Oh I recognize you! Wriggle Nightbug is your name!
I’m confused, Lady Meia. Do you live in a boat?
I’m confused, Lady Meia and Lady Jura. Do the two of you live in a boat?
Despite your bickering, I see the truth. The two of you are comrades, through and through.
Hold on… you live on a flying ship… full of women… named The Nirvana?
Hmmm….
Hmm… no, it’s not like that gap youkai’s magic…
I’ve a hunch about that one… but I need more evidence before I can know for sure.
Monika, I don’t want to cause a fuss, but I’ve noticed for a while now your desires are somewhat… nonstandard.
Your desires place you as a princess of Makai. I believe another daughter of the goddess of Makai lives in the Forest of Magic.
Ohoho! What a spectacular job you’ve done, “Ping.” Even I was fooled for a split second.
Ohoho! So the truth is now revealed! What you say is true, Lady Mulan, men fall so easily for such disguises!
So you shall keep your weapon? Respectable. I know all too well how a sword can become an extension of one’s body.
I've looked into your heart Natsuki... though you look young, your desires are that of an adult.
It’s reassuring to know the fairies in Gensokyo are no more annoying than the ones in the outside world.
The problem solving skills expected of a fairy.
Lady Nayru? Fare you well?
Perhaps your libations impaired your skills a wee too much, Lady Nayru?
I would not want to be you tomorrow morning, Lady Nayru.
Thank you for you assistance earlier, Miss Nugi. You remind me of my retainers at the imperial palace.
Nugi, was it? You seem a respectable sort. How would you like to serve me in my dojo?
You must be the goddess of failure, then.
I can tell by your aura you must be a goddess. Of course, gods aren’t anything special compared to myself.
You’re… pink. Very pink. A youkai, I’m guessing?
After staring deeply into your cleavage, I believe I can safely say you are not Unzan, nor even a cloud spirit.
You claim to be fashionable, yet you don’t even posses a cape?
I myself am hailed as the most fashion-forward in Gensokyo. My cape has won over numerous devotees.
Ah, I recognize you now! Miss Sakuya, Head Maid of the Scarlet Mansion, are you not?
I’ve found myself accompanying Kokoro to some of her playdates with Lady Flandoll, and have gotten to know all the mansion’s denizens quite well.
Now that I think about it, Kokoro mentioned Franranruu having a sister as well.
The only inhabitant of the mansion I have yet to meet is Frandle’s sister. No real loss, apparently.
Oh, is something wrong with Lady Flandre? I hope not, she’s such a charming young girl.
Think you intimidating with your little gizmos there?
Normally I would refer to you as “Lady” Revy, but in this instance that seems untrue.
A white-haired maiden with the power of fire? Are you some relative of the Lady Fujiwara?
Miss Saki, I can see from your desires that you are a very lonely girl..
Excellent, tsukumogami. You excel at losing!
Are you some type of.. boat tsukumogami?
Please continue to take bullets- I mean, lose games on my behalf.
Shimakaze! Sacrifice your modesty so that I may brag of my victory!
Shimakaze! All my followers are willing to give their lives for me if need be! Except Seiga.
I have done well to not lose.
Shimakaze, are you acquainted with Futo’s boat?
I've been wondering, are you some manner of horse youkai?
Your desires mark you as... part horse, part human? Be you a youkai?
Not surprising a human could outsmart a youkai. Or a horse.
A Horse Youkai… That would be a Sagari or a Kiran, correct?
I apologize for my earlier outbursts. It’s just… horse desires are hard for me to read.
I mean, does it even matter now?
What more can you lose, really?
Well… now you’re naked.
So Miss Zoey, I see you desire to battle zombies. You wouldn’t hurt poor Yoshika, would you?
I was hoping it would be ~name~. Or anyone, really.
This appears to be a major victory.
Another line of defense has fallen.
No reason to stall. I already know you're going to remove your ~clothing~ in the end.
Time is more valuable than money. Away with your ~clothing~.
Let's see the... what did Sumireko call them? "Guns."
Oh! I'm doing even better than I thought if that's what you're taking off!
Oh my, Sir Pit, you sure are loyal.
You wish to remove something small. Might I get you to reconsider?
Sadly, you only desire to remove your ~clothing~.
I know you only want to remove your ~clothing~. How disappointing.
There's someone here who desires to see you naked. Want to know who it is?
Since I already know all of you from your desires, shouldn't you simply bear it all?
I can tell you want to settle for just your ~clothing~. Let's negotiate.
Ranking systems via the wearing of hats and feathers may have been necessary in Feudal Japan, but here they serve no purpose.
Although I am a woman, I prefer Prince to Princess. Old force of habit.
Question Princess ~name~: why don’t you just pretend to be a guy and call yourself prince? No one ever questions it.
Your uniform appears similar to those of the Moon Rabbits. Are you their ally?
Hmm. Well, the pattern’s rather straightforward, and easy to memorize.
I think your problem, Aimee, is that your danmaku lacks pizzazz. Where’s the multicolored orbs or curvy lasers?
Lady Florina!
I can feel your desire, to keep that which shames you secret, reaching a breaking point. Reveal yourself, Kirigiri Kyoko!
Why would removing socks kill you? It's not like it's a hat.
You are a sailor, correct Lady Meia? Watch out then for the ghosts of the drowned then. They might be Buddhist.
You two are sailors, correct? Watch out then for the ghosts of the drowned then. They might be Buddhist.
Nor does it resemble the abilities of the amanojaku goddess of the moon.
Were I one of these charming Western brawlers, I suppose my stage name would be Rainbow Miko!
Lady Rarity! That barrier’s preventing us from seeing your nude form!
This barrier must be some sort of insidious youkai trick!
Are you one of the Librarian’s assistants, small girl? Last time I was there, I saw another succubus.
Where’s all that danmaku coming from anyway?
I've no fixation on feet. Good thing too, in retrospect.
Are there people enamoured with feet? It's a good thing I'm not, considering...
I've heard a rumor the Hourai Pharmacist sells penis-growing medicine. I wonder...
I guess I can see the appeal.
Woah! I see you're quite excited!
So if I truly was a man, I'd have a rod like that between my legs. Fascinating...
And by door, I mean my secret hermit dimension accessible through cracks in the ground.
Soon the veil will drop, and all will be exposed. I look forward to it.
Welll, it's not like I would want to control everything people wear anyway.
You have little more to guard you than a few precious strips of cloth.
This view pleases me.
I knew from the beginning you would discard your ~clothing~.
One step closer to my victory- and your “pleasure.”
I do not wish to be seen bullying the weak. If you are confident, however, I see no reason to refuse.
Your next line is…
If you don’t study properly in school, you will be disadvantaged in the future.
A simple display compared to the danmaku in Gensokyo.
Oh, wait. You're human...-ish?
A banana? Is that a tool of her clown magic? Perhaps I should ask the mansion’s librarian.
Don’t look at the banana! It’s how she drives you to insanity!
Oh, you are but a human with a silly costume. I understand now.
I think you might be a human after all. I'm not positive though.
That's a very impressive spell, girl. You almost pass yourself off as a real human.
Lady Misato. My consort lost her legs, and is also a ghost. Something as minor as a scar would never phase me.
You needn’t worry about me being disturbed at the sight of a scar. Yoshika has those all over her body!
Oh I know! You must be a hermit like myself! How do you do, fellow immortal?
Still, it’s much more liberating to show yourself as your are, is it not?
A pity you can’t magic yourself up a few more brain cells along with that dress.
It’s fine, it’s fine. Just remember not to overindulge.
Yes, there can be no doubt! You are Unzan, the cloud spirit of the Buddhist nun Ichirin!
Though it is doubtful I would be able to enjoy Unzan’s body regardless, seeing as he is an old man.
Well, at least the result was worth it. Next time though, allow us to see your disrobing.
Did you truly have to put up a barrier for this? Not that I am disappointed with the results, mind.
Ahahaha! Oh I jest. I recognize you, Lady Remilia. The weaker Scarlet Sister, right?
Ohohoho! My apologies, that was too rich to pass up. I knew the whole time you were Rumia- I mean, Remilia Scarlet.
Eheheheh! Obviously, my ability to read hearts and desires allowed me to instantly recognize you when you stepped through the door, Miss.. uh… Lady Flandre’s sister.
Mwahahaha! This has gone on long enough. My apologies, Remi-chan, but I was pulling your leg about everything. Except when I mentioned Lady Marisa robbing you, that was real.
I mean, we could see your panties since the beginning. This ends up being a bit of a let down.
I've heard a rumor the Hourai Pharmacist sells penis-growing medicine. I wonder...
Eh? Futo never said they would be that big!
How does that even fit? Not like I want to try myself, but still!
Seiga was right- that thing could eat me!
It's about to appear! The best organ of all.
The walls have fallen. Now it's time to reveal your inner sanctum.
Don't feel bad. I won't judge you for what you've got down there.
Back in the Sixth Century, I could never have shown mine- so keep your head held high.
Please don’t keep us waiting. Desires are swelling for the removal of your ~clothing~.
Odd, I can detect no desire within you for victory. Are you some kind of weirdo?
I feel a little bad, making you undress. You know, I have a daughter I think is about your age.
I know! Next time I’ll blow off my clothes with Hermit Sign "Emperor of the Land of the Rising Sun”!
Oh, your friends sure are active today!
Oh, your friends pelt you with danmaku as well? What’s this spell called?
There can be no mistake! You two are without a doubt acolytes of that vile Buddhist nun Byakuren!
There can be no mistake! You two are without a doubt acolytes of that vile Buddhist nun Byakuren!
Not the first girl I’ve seen get drunk and run around naked. Seeing as I live in Gensokyo, definitely not the last.
Wait, you can just… bump this thing and knock it over?
Oh, but it should be fine. Kokoro told me they were going to play a game tonight.
Ah, wait, no need to worry. My Kokoro and Miss Koishi were coming over to play.
Shimakaze! Lay down your life- I mean your panties- for your almighty sovereign!
Wait, you’re taking off…!
I feel as if a Kiran already appeared, but for the life of me I can’t remember-
Good choice, ~name~. Though my victory is inevitable, I am in no hurry to see your genitalia.
Remember, surrender is an option.
Okay.
Your loss only stregnthens my hold upon this table.
Not every victory needs to be thrilling, I suppose.
If you want to amass followers, you need to add much more pizzazz to your actions!
Were I still taking care to disguise myself as a man on the modern day, I suppose I might wear such a thing.
Oh no! ~name~ has already driven Natsuki to madness with his Dark Clown Arts!
Hold on. You’re not Clownpiece. My mistake, carry on
By the way, who is "Zelda" and where did you learn of such acts?
You want to do what to Zelda? Naughty!
Oh, and did I mention everyone in Gensokyo can fly on their own?
If so, then please refer to me as Her Royal Dudeness.
Chip away at the smallest pieces and the largest will fall in time. A great general such as I knows this much.
Not all of us are going to live forever! I will, but the others might not.
The only thing with real value is speed.
Well, I suppose you had to remove your ~clothing~ eventually.
Your ~clothing~ won’t be the last garment you lose. I guarantee it.
I wonder if I could gather more faith wearing something like that.
Oh, my apologies. My mind seems to have wandered there.
I’m not going to say anything and attempt to make this the least amount of awkward possible.
Sir Kira, I think it goes without saying: you will not be acting upon your desires here.
I tried to ask that Celestial Tenshi back home, but it’s hard to drag an answer out of that brat.
Juuust kidding!
Gensokyo is full of minor gods. Of course, it has only one Almighty Taoist who Controls the Cosmos.
Hmph. I had expected better- you’d never survive the training to become a hermit if this is the best you can do.
You did well, Sir ~name~. Not as good as I, but that's to be expected.
You battled until the end. Well done.
All right, now do the thing.
I may just learn something from watching this display.
I will observe how men create their own pleasure.
Harmony is to be valued. Meaning you shall never oppose me again.
Well Pit, It seems your devotion to the Goddess of Trite has yielded no boons.
Do I have to watch? Fine.
Just don't get anything on me!
No way this is going to get old.
You are truly a wonderful human. I have much to learn from you. Well, there's nobody who doesn't have something they could learn, I suppose…
What a splendid image of a blooming young flower!
Byakuren would abhor a woman giving into her instincts so freely. See why her way of thinking is inferior?
Heheh, don't tell her I said this, but Tojiko loves to be touched in that spot as well.
You've got some desires, ~player~. Too bad I doubt this establishment would permit doing that to ~name~.
Those squeaks and moans escaping your lips tell me you’re doing something very well, ~name~.
Lady ~name~, it seems your performance has left both ~player~ and I enraptured. Well done.
If you need any suggestions on what to try, please don’t hesitate to ask. Otherwise, I will leave you to it.
Are those desires the sort of thing all women of your era pleasure themselves to?
Give yourself over to your desires, Lady ~name~.
Now's not the time to let up.
That sound, is it the cooing of a pigeon?
Woah, she's flying! Flying! Wait, myself and everyone I know can fly.
I guess even youkai satisfy their desires same as humans.
So Aimee… you might know… how would I go about convincing my wife to let me have a harem?
Crown Prince- you’re lucky to have one wife, you know?
I wish I could work up the nerve to ask Yuuka if she does that as well.
I don’t see the appeal in performing such acts with yourself. My wife is more suited to my tastes than I am.
Emphasis on taste.
This is why I wanted to keep my headphones. People with odd desires, like Moon.
A clown and a fairy. A more diabolical combination does not exist.
I wonder if Yuuka, Youkai of Flowers, does the same thing?
Although who knows what Yuuka would do to me if I asked her. Though I am immortal, I dare not risk it.
A maid and a China girl. I’ve seen that combination before.
Is this a wrestling match? Well… whatever the way you like it, that’s the way to do it.

Tojikoooooo! Fetch me some saké! … I’m sure she’s getting it right now.
Most gracious, Lady Sei. I shall have this establishment’s finest sake, please.
Oh, I forgot about your shikigami. Have him pledge his loyalty to me too.
Shimakaze, please. You are of no use to me if you can’t give your life in my defense.
A lovely name, Lady Ochako. I see within you a desire to help others- most commendable.
Quirk, Ochako? Do you mean an ability- like to manipulate feng shui or cause lightning?
Would being able to listen to ten conversations at once suffice as a quirk? Or would my mystical abilities be better suited?
I'll take you on!
Let me briefly explain my life. When I was born my mother disguised me as a boy, since Sixth Century Japanese women didn’t have the same rights as men. Or any rights, really.
It was surprisingly easy to deceive an entire nation. Men’s clothes and a fake beard did the trick. After all, who would ask a monarch to drop their pants?
Though I had to disguise myself as a prince, a few did find out my true sex during my reign. For instance my aunt, Empress Suiko, on whose behalf I officially ruled.
My consort Tojiko of the Soga clan, known as Tojiko no Iratsume, very much found out about my sex. Fortunately, she preferred to have a woman.
Somehow, the head of the Soga clan, Umako, uncovered the truth- as did his cunning wife, Mononobe no Futo-hime. They were the true rulers of Japan, operating from the shadows.
I was found out by the Wicked, Unreasonable, and Unjust Hermit, Seiga Kaku. Because I told her, she said she’d make me immortal. But not that many people knew the truth. Really.
Ah, you were wondering, ~player~, why I am still called “Crown Prince” though the world has changed in the fourteen hundred years I slept.
In Gensokyo, and in the modern world, there is no reason to hide my womanhood. However, to be called anything but Crown Prince would not sit well with me.
Perhaps it is naught but empty habit, however “Crown Prince” is the appellation I choose to this day.
I see that has cleared up any confusion you had regarding my title. Now, did I ever tell you about the time Seiga stole Christmas?
Futo was a Mononobe who studied Taoism under me, but conspired with her husband Soga no Umako to eradicate her own clan.
The Soga clan and the Mononobe clan were fierce political rivals during my reign. Anyway I killed all the Mononobes and Mokou’s grandpa killed all the Sogas.
I used to be more discerning with my alcohol consumption. My compatriots in Gensokyo drink without discrimination and and I’m afraid they’ve rubbed off on me.
I sense some confusion in your heart, ~player~, about why I am called “Crown Prince.” By which I mean, you’re worried I’ve got a penis.
~player~, did I ever tell you about the time I solved the Perfect Possession Incident almost all by myself?
If you know the “ten desires” of a human being, you know everything about them- their past, present, and future.
My face is on money.
Though they are “business rivals,” so to speak, I find myself enjoying my time spent with the other religious leaders of Gensokyo.
The truth in Gensokyo is more malleable than in other worlds. Nevertheless, my marriage to Tojiko is a matter of historical record.
I don’t think at this stage I’ll be having any more children, though. Too bad as well. I’d love to impregnate Tojiko!
Because she studied the Taoist arts, after death Tojiko ended up as a ghost with a corporeal body. Eheheh…
It was because of Futo that Tojiko failed to properly resurrect in a new body. Did I mention Futo is Tojiko’s mother? I know someone who’s not getting a card this year~!
Do you not wish to see my nude physique, dealer? I’m almost insulted.
~player~, how'd you like to join my Taoist clan and promote stability in Gensokyo?
Have you considered pledging your loyalty to the Taoists, ~player~?
I will not be taking off my ceremonial rod. It’s not clothing.
As a genius tactician, I can see what is the battle, and what is the war.
Are you related to the Youkai of Flowers, Princess Amalia?
Princess Amalia, know you a troublesome youkai called Yuuka?
Madam Joey, are you an Earth Clown or a Hell Clown?
Don’t be silly Lady Meia, Japan is but one part of my planet. I don’t rule over the whole thing… yet.
How rude, Lady Jura. I would never cheat on Tojiko. Especially not with a married woman. Who’s also her mother. It’s complicated.
Meia, you say two women from your realm can make babies? I think the Hourai Pharmacist of Gensokyo can do the same.
I think I heard you muttering earlier about an "Asuka Period"? Anyway, that's when I'm from.

I suppose I should be thankful no one in the royal court asked this of me, lest my true sex be exposed.

Though I'm sure I could develop a Hermit spell to see through clothes, this method seems... sexier.

What clothes do you desire least, Lady ~name~?
Perhaps we should form a consensus about what you must take off next?
Good, this should be pleasing to the eye.

A clown, eh? I’ve heard of stories of the havoc and terror they sow.
You’ve drinks? Is it a party? I would have brought sake had I known.
The way you’re downing that libation reminds me of… everyone.
You know, Byakuren doesn’t drink. But all the disciples at her temple sneak libations when she isn’t looking. Isn’t that sad?
Aah, booze. The engine of Gensokyo.
I must say, your wardrobe is exquisite. Now take it all off.
Something about this one seems familiar… though I don’t recognize their desires…
I know! You’re ~name~, correct? From the "Electronic Game" that Sumireko girl was talking about?

By the way, I'm glad to see my country continue to thrive a millenia after I left.
On the outside where as much as 1400 years have passed, do the people still speak rightly of my exploits?
It's now or never, so you've got make your decision.

So Princess ~name~, are you the kind of princess who disguises herself as a man and rules their country with wisdom and splendor? Or some other kind?
You handle losing with dignity and grace, Princess.
Princess ~name~, how would you like to unite our two lands? First I need to have a daughter though, for you to marry.
You're quite lovely, Prince ~name~.
Have you ever dreamed of meeting a handsome prince, Lady ~name~?
Hello person I know not. Let's not speak of this again.

Four of a Kind? Wow! I'm as great as I think I am!

Excellent. For the sake of those who admire me, I cannot lose.

Are you some sort of bug youkai, ~name~?

Hmmm….

I’ve a hunch about that one… but I need more evidence before I can know for sure.

Ohoho! What a spectacular job you’ve done, “Ping.” Even I was fooled for a split second.

Let me briefly explain my life. When I was born my mother disguised me as a boy, since Sixth Century Japanese women didn’t have the same rights as men. Or any rights, really.
It was surprisingly easy to deceive an entire nation. Men’s clothes and a fake beard did the trick. After all, who would ask a monarch to drop their pants?
Though I had to disguise myself as a prince, a few did find out my true sex during my reign. For instance my aunt, Empress Suiko, on whose behalf I officially ruled.
My consort Tojiko of the Soga clan, known as Tojiko no Iratsume, very much found out about my sex. Fortunately, she preferred to have a woman.
Somehow, the head of the Soga clan, Umako, uncovered the truth- as did his cunning wife, Mononobe no Futo-hime. They were the true rulers of Japan, operating from the shadows.
I was found out by the Wicked, Unreasonable, and Unjust Hermit, Seiga Kaku. Because I told her, she said she’d make me immortal. But not that many people knew the truth. Really.
Ah, you were wondering, ~player~, why I am still called “Crown Prince” though the world has changed in the fourteen hundred years I slept.
In Gensokyo, and in the modern world, there is no reason to hide my womanhood. However, to be called anything but Crown Prince would not sit well with me.
Perhaps it is naught but empty habit, however “Crown Prince” is the appellation I choose to this day.

Let me briefly explain my life. When I was born my mother disguised me as a boy, since Sixth Century Japanese women didn’t have the same rights as men. Or any rights, really.
It was surprisingly easy to deceive an entire nation. Men’s clothes and a fake beard did the trick. After all, who would ask a monarch to drop their pants?
Though I had to disguise myself as a prince, a few did find out my true sex during my reign. For instance my aunt, Empress Suiko, on whose behalf I officially ruled.
My consort Tojiko of the Soga clan, known as Tojiko no Iratsume, very much found out about my sex. Fortunately, she preferred to have a woman.
Somehow, the head of the Soga clan, Umako, uncovered the truth- as did his cunning wife, Mononobe no Futo-hime. They were the true rulers of Japan, operating from the shadows.
I was found out by the Wicked, Unreasonable, and Unjust Hermit, Seiga Kaku. Because I told her, she said she’d make me immortal. But not that many people knew the truth. Really.
Ah, you were wondering, ~player~, why I am still called “Crown Prince” though the world has changed in the fourteen hundred years I slept.
In Gensokyo, and in the modern world, there is no reason to hide my womanhood. However, to be called anything but Crown Prince would not sit well with me.
Perhaps it is naught but empty habit, however “Crown Prince” is the appellation I choose to this day.

Let me briefly explain my life. When I was born my mother disguised me as a boy, since Sixth Century Japanese women didn’t have the same rights as men. Or any rights, really.
It was surprisingly easy to deceive an entire nation. Men’s clothes and a fake beard did the trick. After all, who would ask a monarch to drop their pants?
Though I had to disguise myself as a prince, a few did find out my true sex during my reign. For instance my aunt, Empress Suiko, on whose behalf I officially ruled.
My consort Tojiko of the Soga clan, known as Tojiko no Iratsume, very much found out about my sex. Fortunately, she preferred to have a woman.
Somehow, the head of the Soga clan, Umako, uncovered the truth- as did his cunning wife, Mononobe no Futo-hime. They were the true rulers of Japan, operating from the shadows.
I was found out by the Wicked, Unreasonable, and Unjust Hermit, Seiga Kaku. Because I told her, she said she’d make me immortal. But not that many people knew the truth. Really.
Ah, you were wondering, ~player~, why I am still called “Crown Prince” though the world has changed in the fourteen hundred years I slept.
In Gensokyo, and in the modern world, there is no reason to hide my womanhood. However, to be called anything but Crown Prince would not sit well with me.
Perhaps it is naught but empty habit, however “Crown Prince” is the appellation I choose to this day.
I see that has cleared up any confusion you had regarding my title. Now, did I ever tell you about the time Seiga stole Christmas?
Futo was a Mononobe who studied Taoism under me, but conspired with her husband Soga no Umako to eradicate her own clan.
The Soga clan and the Mononobe clan were fierce political rivals during my reign. Anyway I killed all the Mononobes and Mokou’s grandpa killed all the Sogas.
I used to be more discerning with my alcohol consumption. My compatriots in Gensokyo drink without discrimination and and I’m afraid they’ve rubbed off on me.

Since coming to Gensokyo, I worry my comrade Futo has become vulgar and airheaded. Though she was always an odd one.
I’m not short by the way. In case you were thinking that. In the sixth century, this was a pretty average height.
Tojiko is one of the few who see me as a person more than a legend. Perhaps that is why she rarely joins in my escapades.
I introduced Buddhism into Japan as a ruse to pacify the people. Never did I imagine it would be used against me to deny my resurrection!
I don’t think at this stage I’ll be having any more children, though. Too bad as well. I’d love to impregnate Tojiko!

It was surprisingly easy to deceive an entire nation. Men’s clothes and a fake beard did the trick. After all, who would ask a monarch to drop their pants?

My consort Tojiko of the Soga clan, known as Tojiko no Iratsume, very much found out about my sex. Fortunately, she preferred to have a woman.
Somehow, the head of the Soga clan, Umako, uncovered the truth- as did his cunning wife, Mononobe no Futo-hime. They were the true rulers of Japan, operating from the shadows.
I was found out by the Wicked, Unreasonable, and Unjust Hermit, Seiga Kaku. Because I told her, she said she’d make me immortal. But not that many people knew the truth. Really.

Don’t be silly Lady Meia, Japan is but one part of my planet. I don’t rule over the whole thing… yet.
How rude, Lady Jura. I would never cheat on Tojiko. Especially not with a married woman. Who’s also her mother. It’s complicated.
Meia, you say two women from your realm can make babies? I think the Hourai Pharmacist of Gensokyo can do the same.
I think I heard you muttering earlier about an "Asuka Period"? Anyway, that's when I'm from.
I must say Lady Nayru, you’re a mean drunk.
So you’re better at cards when drunk, Lady Nayru? I suppose the same could be said of my compatriots in Gensokyo with danmaku.
Be sure to drink plenty of water, Nayru. You don’t want a hangover.
Oh, and it seems you brought a friend, Miss Sakuya. Is this little one a maid in training?
And it appears you let one of the fairy maids tag along, Miss Sakuya. I must say, her peasant attire is simply adorable.
Miss Sakuya, please thank your mistress for her hospitality. By the way, is this girl one of your new hires?
And it appears Lady Furandoore saw fit to invite this bat-winged urchin into her home. Truly her heart has no limits.
Seiga Niang-Niang and Miss Meiling seem to get along well. I saw the two of them speaking in Chinese earlier. They looked over at me and laughed… I wonder what that could mean?
If you do work in the library, it is a most noble job. I even find myself aiding scholars. Just the other day I helped Lady Marisa check out several rare books!
Tojikoooooo! Fetch me some saké! … I’m sure she’s getting it right now.
Most gracious, Lady Sei. I shall have this establishment’s finest sake, please.
Oh, I forgot about your shikigami. Have him pledge his loyalty to me too.
Shimakaze, please. You are of no use to me if you can’t give your life in my defense.
A lovely name, Lady Ochako. I see within you a desire to help others- most commendable.
Quirk, Ochako? Do you mean an ability- like to manipulate feng shui or cause lightning?
Would being able to listen to ten conversations at once suffice as a quirk? Or would my mystical abilities be better suited?
I wanted to let everyone here know I could fly if I chose to. I just don't feel like it right now.
So which one of you is Miss Margatroid again?
I’m glad you understand there is no need to talk, ~player~. I can see into your heart and perfectly hear your side of the conversation.
Let me briefly explain my life. When I was born my mother disguised me as a boy, since Sixth Century Japanese women didn’t have the same rights as men. Or any rights, really.
It was surprisingly easy to deceive an entire nation. Men’s clothes and a fake beard did the trick. After all, who would ask a monarch to drop their pants?
Though I had to disguise myself as a prince, a few did find out my true sex during my reign. For instance my aunt, Empress Suiko, on whose behalf I officially ruled.
My consort Tojiko of the Soga clan, known as Tojiko no Iratsume, very much found out about my sex. Fortunately, she preferred to have a woman.
Somehow, the head of the Soga clan, Umako, uncovered the truth- as did his cunning wife, Mononobe no Futo-hime. They were the true rulers of Japan, operating from the shadows.
I was found out by the Wicked, Unreasonable, and Unjust Hermit, Seiga Kaku. Because I told her, she said she’d make me immortal. But not that many people knew the truth. Really.
Ah, you were wondering, ~player~, why I am still called “Crown Prince” though the world has changed in the fourteen hundred years I slept.
In Gensokyo, and in the modern world, there is no reason to hide my womanhood. However, to be called anything but Crown Prince would not sit well with me.
Perhaps it is naught but empty habit, however “Crown Prince” is the appellation I choose to this day.
I see that has cleared up any confusion you had regarding my title. Now, did I ever tell you about the time Seiga stole Christmas?
Know any of you a girl named Robin? Sumireko claimed that she was her “wife,” though I have my doubts about that.
I wonder how well a "Gatcha" game based on the girls of Gensokyo would do. We are ripe with what Sumireko calls "waifus."
Futo was a Mononobe who studied Taoism under me, but conspired with her husband Soga no Umako to eradicate her own clan.
The Soga clan and the Mononobe clan were fierce political rivals during my reign. Anyway I killed all the Mononobes and Mokou’s grandpa killed all the Sogas.
I used to be more discerning with my alcohol consumption. My compatriots in Gensokyo drink without discrimination and and I’m afraid they’ve rubbed off on me.
You may be wondering where my ceremonial rod goes when I’m not using it. That’s easy. It’s magic.
I’m ambidextrous, by the way. If you were wondering why my ceremonial baton shifts from hand to hand.
The proper name for my ritual baton is a shaku. I find many outsiders aren’t familiar with it.
My sword is a Chinese jian known as the Shichi-Sei Ken, or Seven-Star Sword.
Most of the time people try to hold conversations with me, they just spout boring nonsense like “You’re mistaken I’m not a hermit” and “This isn’t necessary stop fighting me”.
My wife passed away a while ago. Anyway you met her earlier. Other than the ghost legs she’s pretty much the same as ever.
Were I to unsheathe my sword, all would be blinded by its magnificence. Including myself, frustratingly.
Are you wondering how I got here? I have no need for Occult Balls or Gaps. Every crack contains infinite space, which I can inhabit.
Not every story you've heard about me is true. For instance, I wasn't born in a stable.
~player~, should you hold an interest in the Taoist Arts, my dojo is accessible from any crack.
”Danmaku?” It is the term of the colored bullets we citizens of Gensokyo shoot each other with, either for fun or to annihilate our opponents.
Gensokyo is the land of illusion. All that passes into myth passes into Gensokyo.
I don’t think at this stage I’ll be having any more children, though. Too bad as well. I’d love to impregnate Tojiko!
Because she studied the Taoist arts, after death Tojiko ended up as a ghost with a corporeal body. Eheheh…
It was because of Futo that Tojiko failed to properly resurrect in a new body. Did I mention Futo is Tojiko’s mother? I know someone who’s not getting a card this year~!
Deliver to me ~cards~ cards.
~cards~ would be a viable strategy!
~cards~ cards, at once!
I desire ~cards~ cards.
If you can't hear my desires, I would like ~cards~ cards.
Spell Card: Honor "Ranks of ~cards~ Cards!"
Is this a Buddhist plot?
It's a Moriya Shrine conspiracy!
I wonder if Yoshika would eat these cards for me...
Yukari is fooling around again...
Now witness a miracle as I, Toyosatomimi no Miko, win with this paltry hand!
Are those damn poverty god sisters skulking about?
I shall forgive you dealer, if only for a bit.
These cards are not worthy of me. Still, I shall accept them.
Crown Prince... you don't have a damn thing.
Crown Prince, this hand is garbage.
Crown Prince, are you even trying to preserve your modesty?
I miss my cape.
The earth hasn't changed from the age of the gods, and the seas are still filled to the brim. Why must humans be forced to accept death?
Are you related to the Youkai of Flowers, Princess Amalia?
Princess Amalia, know you a troublesome youkai called Yuuka?
You know Beatrix, you’re kind of a pain. Though as long as you don’t trap me in an infinite hallway you’re not the worst doctor I’ve ever encountered.
Say Jenetta, are you a Moon Rabbit, or one of the Inaba at the Eternal Princess’s castle?
Madam Joey, are you an Earth Clown or a Hell Clown?
Don’t be silly Lady Meia, Japan is but one part of my planet. I don’t rule over the whole thing… yet.
How rude, Lady Jura. I would never cheat on Tojiko. Especially not with a married woman. Who’s also her mother. It’s complicated.
Meia, you say two women from your realm can make babies? I think the Hourai Pharmacist of Gensokyo can do the same.
By the way, I’d like to put in a complaint that one of Makai’s prisoners escaped. Her name: Byakuren Hijiri. Please come collect her
I must say Lady Nayru, you’re a mean drunk.
So you’re better at cards when drunk, Lady Nayru? I suppose the same could be said of my compatriots in Gensokyo with danmaku.
Be sure to drink plenty of water, Nayru. You don’t want a hangover.
Oh, and it seems you brought a friend, Miss Sakuya. Is this little one a maid in training?

Shimakaze, please. You are of no use to me if you can’t give your life in my defense.

I used to be more discerning with my alcohol consumption. My compatriots in Gensokyo drink without discrimination and and I’m afraid they’ve rubbed off on me.
Since coming to Gensokyo, I worry my comrade Futo has become vulgar and airheaded. Though she was always an odd one.
I’m not short by the way. In case you were thinking that. In the sixth century, this was a pretty average height.
Tojiko is one of the few who see me as a person more than a legend. Perhaps that is why she rarely joins in my escapades.
I introduced Buddhism into Japan as a ruse to pacify the people. Never did I imagine it would be used against me to deny my resurrection!
I don’t think at this stage I’ll be having any more children, though. Too bad as well. I’d love to impregnate Tojiko!
Because she studied the Taoist arts, after death Tojiko ended up as a ghost with a corporeal body. Eheheh…
It was because of Futo that Tojiko failed to properly resurrect in a new body. Did I mention Futo is Tojiko’s mother? I know someone who’s not getting a card this year~!
Crown Prince. Isn’t the first rule of politics give the people what they want?
Crown Prince, you know the best way to gather followers is putting on a show!
Have you forgotten, Crown Prince, your own body’s desires?
Now, attempt to defeat me! And I shall become a living legend!
Ah, it seems I lost. Well, since I have nothing else left to wager, I might as well leave.
This has been an enjoyable evening, but I simply must go. Farewell.
Ah. Well, what can you do? I shall be taking my leave now, thanks for the exciting game.
Show us something good!
Show some skin! Make this exciting!
Let's see some of your best attributes.
Tojiko, turn around! ~name~'s about to show some skin!
Please take pity on this poor, immortal, sexually-active monarch.
Oh, this is about to get even better.
So ~name~, you’re from the land where the sun sets? I’m from the land where the sun rises. It’s the better one.
A clown, eh? I’ve heard of stories of the havoc and terror they sow.
You’ve drinks? Is it a party? I would have brought sake had I known.
The way you’re downing that libation reminds me of… everyone.
You know, Byakuren doesn’t drink. But all the disciples at her temple sneak libations when she isn’t looking. Isn’t that sad?
Aah, booze. The engine of Gensokyo.
I must say, your wardrobe is exquisite. Now take it all off.
Something about this one seems familiar… though I don’t recognize their desires…
I know! You’re ~name~, correct? From the "Electronic Game" that Sumireko girl was talking about?
It's now or never, so you've got make your decision.
From one royal to another, I respect you resolve, Princess ~name~.
So Princess ~name~, are you the kind of princess who disguises herself as a man and rules their country with wisdom and splendor? Or some other kind?
You handle losing with dignity and grace, Princess.
Princess ~name~, how would you like to unite our two lands? First I need to have a daughter though, for you to marry.
You're quite lovely, Prince ~name~.
Have you ever dreamed of meeting a handsome prince, Lady ~name~?
Hello person I know not. Let's not speak of this again.
By the way, if you recognize me it’s because you mistook me for another gorgeous, wise, and powerful Taoist leader.
You know ~name~… your dark aura reminds me of someone…
So… are you a good witch, or a Buddhist witch?
Witch girl! You had better not steal my garments after the game!
It seems you could not "steal" victory, witch.
Aella has such an imposing figure. There can be no doubt about it- this girl is an Oni!
Say, are you sure you're not an Oni?
The only difference between you and an Oni is sobriety.
Oh? What’s that gizmo for?
Let’s see your new spellcard, then.
More danmaku? It doesn’t look much different than your other spellcards though.
Let’s see if my teachings have made a difference for you.
Perhaps it would be more effective were I to demonstrate proper danmaku?
Did you expect more friends to drop by, Agent Cammy?
I sense more of your friends are coming. Greetings, I am Toyosatomimi no-
Oh, it appears we're earmuff sisters! Yours are most charming.
I apologize for everything that Futo did to you.
Even a clown is no match for my Taoist arts!
Oh no! Stand back everyone! She’s about to unleash her lunatic clown magic!
Clown magic!? Stare not at her, lest your mind be driven to madness
So you two say you come from a world of only women? But I haven’t seen you in Gensokyo before.
Hold on… you live on a flying ship… full of women… named The Nirvana?
Let me look into your heart, Miss Lotte. I shall see if you are an evil witch, or if you’re the kind that isn’t Buddhist.
Miss Lotte, if you desire to learn true sorcery you could always become one of my Taoist acolytes.
Feel free to take my photo, Mahiru. After all, I am gorgeous.
Are you related to that butterfly fairy?
Are you some sort of bug youkai, ~name~?
Oh I recognize you! Wriggle Nightbug is your name!
I’m confused, Lady Meia. Do you live in a boat?
I’m confused, Lady Meia and Lady Jura. Do the two of you live in a boat?
Despite your bickering, I see the truth. The two of you are comrades, through and through.
Hold on… you live on a flying ship… full of women… named The Nirvana?
Hmmm….
Hmm… no, it’s not like that gap youkai’s magic…
I’ve a hunch about that one… but I need more evidence before I can know for sure.
Monika, I don’t want to cause a fuss, but I’ve noticed for a while now your desires are somewhat… nonstandard.
Your desires place you as a princess of Makai. I believe another daughter of the goddess of Makai lives in the Forest of Magic.
Ohoho! What a spectacular job you’ve done, “Ping.” Even I was fooled for a split second.
Ohoho! So the truth is now revealed! What you say is true, Lady Mulan, men fall so easily for such disguises!
So you shall keep your weapon? Respectable. I know all too well how a sword can become an extension of one’s body.
I've looked into your heart Natsuki... though you look young, your desires are that of an adult.
It’s reassuring to know the fairies in Gensokyo are no more annoying than the ones in the outside world.
The problem solving skills expected of a fairy.
Lady Nayru? Fare you well?
Perhaps your libations impaired your skills a wee too much, Lady Nayru?
I would not want to be you tomorrow morning, Lady Nayru.
Thank you for you assistance earlier, Miss Nugi. You remind me of my retainers at the imperial palace.
Nugi, was it? You seem a respectable sort. How would you like to serve me in my dojo?
You must be the goddess of failure, then.
You’re… pink. Very pink. A youkai, I’m guessing?
After staring deeply into your cleavage, I believe I can safely say you are not Unzan, nor even a cloud spirit.
You claim to be fashionable, yet you don’t even posses a cape?
I myself am hailed as the most fashion-forward in Gensokyo. My cape has won over numerous devotees.
Ah, I recognize you now! Miss Sakuya, Head Maid of the Scarlet Mansion, are you not?
I’ve found myself accompanying Kokoro to some of her playdates with Lady Flandoll, and have gotten to know all the mansion’s denizens quite well.
Now that I think about it, Kokoro mentioned Franranruu having a sister as well.
The only inhabitant of the mansion I have yet to meet is Frandle’s sister. No real loss, apparently.
Oh, is something wrong with Lady Flandre? I hope not, she’s such a charming young girl.
Think you intimidating with your little gizmos there?
Normally I would refer to you as “Lady” Revy, but in this instance that seems untrue.
A white-haired maiden with the power of fire? Are you some relative of the Lady Fujiwara?
Miss Saki, I can see from your desires that you are a very lonely girl..
Are you some type of.. boat tsukumogami?
You’ve failed to protect me Shimikaze! It seems what Reimu said about shipgirls was true!
Not surprising a human could outsmart a youkai. Or a horse.
A Horse Youkai… That would be a Sagari or a Kiran, correct?
I apologize for my earlier outbursts. It’s just… horse desires are hard for me to read.
I mean, does it even matter now?
What more can you lose, really?
Well… now you’re naked.
So Miss Zoey, I see you desire to battle zombies. You wouldn’t hurt poor Yoshika, would you?
I was hoping it would be ~name~. Or anyone, really.
This appears to be a major victory.
Another line of defense has fallen.
No reason to stall. I already know you're going to remove your ~clothing~ in the end.
Time is more valuable than money. Away with your ~clothing~.
Let's see the... what did Sumireko call them? "Guns."
Oh! I'm doing even better than I thought if that's what you're taking off!
Oh my, Sir Pit, you sure are loyal.
You wish to remove something small. Might I get you to reconsider?
Sadly, you only desire to remove your ~clothing~.
I know you only want to remove your ~clothing~. How disappointing.
There's someone here who desires to see you naked. Want to know who it is?
Since I already know all of you from your desires, shouldn't you simply bear it all?
I can tell you want to settle for just your ~clothing~. Let's negotiate.
Ranking systems via the wearing of hats and feathers may have been necessary in Feudal Japan, but here they serve no purpose.
Although I am a woman, I prefer Prince to Princess. Old force of habit.
Question Princess ~name~: why don’t you just pretend to be a guy and call yourself prince? No one ever questions it.
Hmm. Well, the pattern’s rather straightforward, and easy to memorize.
I think your problem, Aimee, is that your danmaku lacks pizzazz. Where’s the multicolored orbs or curvy lasers?
Lady Florina!
I can feel your desire, to keep that which shames you secret, reaching a breaking point. Reveal yourself, Kirigiri Kyoko!
Why would removing socks kill you? It's not like it's a hat.
You are a sailor, correct Lady Meia? Watch out then for the ghosts of the drowned then. They might be Buddhist.
You two are sailors, correct? Watch out then for the ghosts of the drowned then. They might be Buddhist.
Nor does it resemble the abilities of the amanojaku goddess of the moon.
Were I one of these charming Western brawlers, I suppose my stage name would be Rainbow Miko!
Lady Rarity! That barrier’s preventing us from seeing your nude form!
This barrier must be some sort of insidious youkai trick!
Are you one of the Librarian’s assistants, small girl? Last time I was there, I saw another succubus.
I've no fixation on feet. Good thing too, in retrospect.
Are there people enamoured with feet? It's a good thing I'm not, considering...
I've heard a rumor the Hourai Pharmacist sells penis-growing medicine. I wonder...
I guess I can see the appeal.
Woah! I see you're quite excited!
So if I truly was a man, I'd have a rod like that between my legs. Fascinating...
And by door, I mean my secret hermit dimension accessible through cracks in the ground.
Soon the veil will drop, and all will be exposed. I look forward to it.
Welll, it's not like I would want to control everything people wear anyway.
You have little more to guard you than a few precious strips of cloth.
This view pleases me.
I knew from the beginning you would discard your ~clothing~.
One step closer to my victory- and your “pleasure.”
Your next line is…
If you don’t study properly in school, you will be disadvantaged in the future.
A simple display compared to the danmaku in Gensokyo.
Oh, wait. You're human...-ish?
A banana? Is that a tool of her clown magic? Perhaps I should ask the mansion’s librarian.
Don’t look at the banana! It’s how she drives you to insanity!
Oh, you are but a human with a silly costume. I understand now.
I think you might be a human after all. I'm not positive though.
That's a very impressive spell, girl. You almost pass yourself off as a real human.
Lady Misato. My consort lost her legs, and is also a ghost. Something as minor as a scar would never phase me.
You needn’t worry about me being disturbed at the sight of a scar. Yoshika has those all over her body!
Oh I know! You must be a hermit like myself! How do you do, fellow immortal?
Still, it’s much more liberating to show yourself as your are, is it not?
A pity you can’t magic yourself up a few more brain cells along with that dress.
It’s fine, it’s fine. Just remember not to overindulge.
Yes, there can be no doubt! You are Unzan, the cloud spirit of the Buddhist nun Ichirin!
Though it is doubtful I would be able to enjoy Unzan’s body regardless, seeing as he is an old man.
Well, at least the result was worth it. Next time though, allow us to see your disrobing.
Did you truly have to put up a barrier for this? Not that I am disappointed with the results, mind.
Ahahaha! Oh I jest. I recognize you, Lady Remilia. The weaker Scarlet Sister, right?
Ohohoho! My apologies, that was too rich to pass up. I knew the whole time you were Rumia- I mean, Remilia Scarlet.
Eheheheh! Obviously, my ability to read hearts and desires allowed me to instantly recognize you when you stepped through the door, Miss.. uh… Lady Flandre’s sister.
Mwahahaha! This has gone on long enough. My apologies, Remi-chan, but I was pulling your leg about everything. Except when I mentioned Lady Marisa robbing you, that was real.
I mean, we could see your panties since the beginning. This ends up being a bit of a let down.
I've heard a rumor the Hourai Pharmacist sells penis-growing medicine. I wonder...
Eh? Futo never said they would be that big!
How does that even fit? Not like I want to try myself, but still!
Seiga was right- that thing could eat me!
It's about to appear! The best organ of all.
The walls have fallen. Now it's time to reveal your inner sanctum.
Don't feel bad. I won't judge you for what you've got down there.
Back in the Sixth Century, I could never have shown mine- so keep your head held high.
Please don’t keep us waiting. Desires are swelling for the removal of your ~clothing~.
Odd, I can detect no desire within you for victory. Are you some kind of weirdo?
I feel a little bad, making you undress. You know, I have a daughter I think is about your age.
I know! Next time I’ll blow off my clothes with Hermit Sign "Emperor of the Land of the Rising Sun”!
Oh, your friends sure are active today!
Oh, your friends pelt you with danmaku as well? What’s this spell called?
There can be no mistake! You two are without a doubt acolytes of that vile Buddhist nun Byakuren!
There can be no mistake! You two are without a doubt acolytes of that vile Buddhist nun Byakuren!
Not the first girl I’ve seen get drunk and run around naked. Seeing as I live in Gensokyo, definitely not the last.
Wait, you can just… bump this thing and knock it over?
Oh, but it should be fine. Kokoro told me they were going to play a game tonight.
Ah, wait, no need to worry. My Kokoro and Miss Koishi were coming over to play.
Wait, you’re taking off…!
I feel as if a Kiran already appeared, but for the life of me I can’t remember-
Good choice, ~name~. Though my victory is inevitable, I am in no hurry to see your genitalia.
Remember, surrender is an option.
Okay.
Your loss only stregnthens my hold upon this table.
Not every victory needs to be thrilling, I suppose.
If you want to amass followers, you need to add much more pizzazz to your actions!
Were I still taking care to disguise myself as a man on the modern day, I suppose I might wear such a thing.
Oh no! ~name~ has already driven Natsuki to madness with his Dark Clown Arts!
Hold on. You’re not Clownpiece. My mistake, carry on
By the way, who is "Zelda" and where did you learn of such acts?
You want to do what to Zelda? Naughty!
Oh, and did I mention everyone in Gensokyo can fly on their own?
If so, then please refer to me as Her Royal Dudeness.
Chip away at the smallest pieces and the largest will fall in time. A great general such as I knows this much.
Not all of us are going to live forever! I will, but the others might not.
The only thing with real value is speed.
Well, I suppose you had to remove your ~clothing~ eventually.
Your ~clothing~ won’t be the last garment you lose. I guarantee it.
I wonder if I could gather more faith wearing something like that.
Oh, my apologies. My mind seems to have wandered there.
I’m not going to say anything and attempt to make this the least amount of awkward possible.
Sir Kira, I think it goes without saying: you will not be acting upon your desires here.
I tried to ask that Celestial Tenshi back home, but it’s hard to drag an answer out of that brat.
Juuust kidding!
Gensokyo is full of minor gods. Of course, it has only one Almighty Taoist who Controls the Cosmos.
Hmph. I had expected better- you’d never survive the training to become a hermit if this is the best you can do.
You did well, Sir ~name~. Not as good as I, but that's to be expected.
You battled until the end. Well done.
All right, now do the thing.
I may just learn something from watching this display.
I will observe how men create their own pleasure.
You bested me, but still couldn't seal your victory? Pathetic, I expected more from you!
I suppose most of those who come to me seeking to learn the way of the Tao also end up as failures.
Well Pit, It seems your devotion to the Goddess of Trite has yielded no boons.
Do I have to watch? Fine.
Just don't get anything on me!
No way this is going to get old.
You are truly a wonderful human. I have much to learn from you. Well, there's nobody who doesn't have something they could learn, I suppose…
What a splendid image of a blooming young flower!
